translation.en: You are actually getting faster than me.
translation.ko: 이제 네가 나보다 빠른 것 같아

translation.en: I'll race you right now.
I'm sorry to ask you.
You've no energy left.
I'm going to beat you.
I'll see you at school.
-Bye. -Okay, bye.
What are you doing up so early?
Seriously? You and Dad were fighting all night,
translation.ko: 몰라서 물어요? 두 분이 밤새 싸우셨잖아요

translation.en: and I heard him leave again this morning.
I'm sorry, sweetheart.
Where are you going?
I just need some time to myself. Go figure out a few things.
Okay, fine. Whatever. Are you going to be back on Monday?
Because I have a track meet on Tuesday and I need a ride.
Your dad will be here.
Right, Dad's never here.
Well, now he will be.
Why, what's going on?
Gran's going to move in for a little while.
Your dad and I talked about it, and we both think that's best right now.
translation.ko: 아빠랑 의논했는데 지금은 이게 최선인 것 같다

translation.en: Gran's moving in, what...
Is this for real?
You leaving us?
I'm not going to be far, and as soon as I get settled,
translation.ko: 멀리 가는 건 아니야 자리 잡으면

translation.en: you'll all come join me.
We'll join you where?
Because I'm not leaving from my senior year.
I'm not going to leave all my friends
just because you're sick of fighting with Dad.
translation.ko: 저까지 친구들 두고 떠날 수는 없어요!

translation.en: I'm sorry, Abby.
Were you even going to say goodbye?
I love you, sweetheart.
Where's Mommy going?
Jess.
She's...
Come here. She won't be long. She's...
translation.ko: 이리 와 엄마 금방 오실 거야

translation.en: She won't be long. Do you want me to make you some breakfast?
translation.ko: 멀리 안 가셨어 아침 차려 줄까?

translation.en: Don't lie to her.
Bree.
Everything's going to be fine.
No, it's not. Nothing's ever going to be fine again.
Kevin.
Due to increases in the overseas third-quarter market contraction
translation.ko: 3분기 들어 해외 시장이 더욱 위축됨에 따라

translation.en: the commodities markets took a tumble,
finishing up only ten points above last year's market record low.
The treasury bills becoming more in demand due to European volatility.
translation.ko: 유럽의 불안정이 미 재무부 증권의 수요 증가로 이어져

translation.en: The treasury department has suspended trading on ten-year T-Bills
-until opening of trading tomorrow. -Serina?
So that interest rates...
Serina?
Serina, it's 7:20, and you're not here.
Can you please call me, and let me know that you're on your way?
I've left checks for the girls' new school uniforms on the table,
translation.ko: 새로 맞출 애들 교복비는 탁자 위에 뒀고

translation.en: and their new backpacks are in the front hall closet.
translation.ko: 새로 산 가방은 현관 앞 옷장에 있어요

translation.en: All right, thank you.
Carrie? Caitlyn?
Girls, time to wake up.
Come on.
-Wake up. -Mom, it's summer.
I know, but Serina's late,
and I have an early work meeting.
I'm going to have to drop you off at Daddy's.
But it's not Daddy's weekend.
Yes, I know.
But I have a breakfast meeting before I go into work, and these particular clients do not understand
translation.ko: 출근 전 조찬 회의가 있는데 만나는 고객이

translation.en: that people have personal lives.
translation.ko: 개인 사정을 이해 못 하는 사람들이라서 그래

translation.en: Can't they come here?
translation.ko: 우리 집으로 오라고 하면 안 돼요?

translation.en: No. They cannot come here, honey.
Don't we have personal lives?
translation.ko: 우리도 개인 사정이 있으면 안 되는 거예요?

translation.en: Yes, you have personal lives, so you go back to sleep
translation.ko: 아니, 있어도 돼 도로 눈 감고 자

translation.en: and I'll ask Mrs. Burnette next door if she will watch you
translation.ko: 옆집 버넷 아주머니께 세리나가 올 때까지만

translation.en: until Serina gets here, okay?
translation.ko: 너희들 좀 봐 달라고 해 볼게

translation.en: Go to sleep.
A potential merger sounds promising,
and I am inclined to recommend it to our clients,
but I still think there are some issues we need to consider.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 전에 몇 가지 문제를 검토할 필요가 있어요

translation.en: Promising? It's a home run.
I'm sorry, I don't understand why we're not fast-tracking.
translation.ko: 죄송해요, 빨리 처리 안 하는 이유를 이해 못 하겠어요

translation.en: Playground is a stand-alone in the youth market.
No one else is offering
monitored interactive social space for teens and preteens.
Which is why this merger makes sense.
Playground gets to maintain the youth market
while still having access to the--
You know what? I have another meeting. Can we pick this up later?
translation.ko: 죄송해요, 회의가 있어요 이 얘기는 다음에 다시 하죠

translation.en: Abby, I'd really like to resolve this before Monday.
translation.ko: 애비, 이 건은 월요일 이전에 매듭지었으면 해요

translation.en: Gabrielle, why don't we give her the weekend
to dot her i's and cross her t's, okay?
What are you drinking?
Kale, spinach, ginger, lemon juice.
-Is it worth it? -Haven't decided yet,
-but I am leaning towards no. -Yeah.
Good luck with that.
Hey. This isn't about me, is it?
Because I'm the one who brought the deal in?
What?
Because Wes and I are involved.
No, of course not.
I just don't want our personal relationship
translation.ko: 우리의 사적인 관계가 업무에 영향을 주는 건

translation.en: to affect what we do here.
You're dating my ex-husband. We don't have a personal relationship.
translation.ko: 댁은 내 전남편과 사귀는 거고 우린 사적인 관계가 아니에요

translation.en: -I just meant-- -No, I know what you meant.
It's your sister.
-Which one? -I didn't ask.
She said it's a matter of life or death.
That's Jess. Tell her I'll call her back.
translation.ko: 그럼 제스예요 나중에 전화한다고 전해 주세요

translation.en: Hi, Jess.
Abby, I need for you to come home.
Okay, I can't. Work is crazy right now.
-You never come home. -I was just home at Christmas.
translation.ko: - 집에 한 번도 안 왔잖아 - 성탄절에 갔거든?

translation.en: That was like a million months ago,
and I wouldn't even ask if it weren't a matter of life and death.
-Is this about a guy? Because I... -No.
This is not about a guy. Why would you even ask that?
translation.ko: 남자 문제 아니라고 여기서 그 얘기가 왜 나와?

translation.en: I'm not a baby.
This is an actual emergency of drastic importance...
Wes.
I didn't want to disturb you at work.
Now is not a good day. I have back-to-back meetings.
translation.ko: 오늘 좀 바쁜데 바로 회의 들어가야 해

translation.en: Yes, I am familiar with your priorities.
I'm not doing this right now.
Fine, we'll come by Saturday and we'll talk.
"We"?
I meant I'll come by.
Great.
Hi.
-Abby! -Jess.
-Is that Wes? Why is Wes there? -You know what?
translation.ko: - 형부였어? 거긴 왜 있어? - 이렇게 하자

translation.en: The girls and I are going to come tonight.
But we can only stay until Sunday.
That's perfect. Thank you so much.
Okay, I'll call Gran and let her know you're coming.
Hello?
Call Serina, have her pack the girls
translation.ko: 세리나한테 애들 가방 싸 놓으라 하고

translation.en: and see if you can get us on the four o'clock flight to Baltimore.
Gentlemen, thank you for waiting.
Hey, can you hand me some more nails?
Lot of help you are.
Don't look at me like that.
I know what I'm doing.
-Okay, thanks. I'll get back to you. -All right, bye.
translation.ko: - 고마워요, 연락 줄게요 - 네, 잘 다녀와요

translation.en: Why didn't Serina come with us?
translation.ko: 세리나 아줌마는 왜 같이 안 왔어요?

translation.en: We're only here for the weekend, and we're going to have so much fun.
Gran is really excited to see you.
She said she'd get our ears pierced tomorrow.
No, I said we would talk about it.
-You promised. -I promised we would talk about it.
There is Grandma Nell.
Abby! Hi!
Go see Gran.
Oh, there are my girls.
Oh, you're home.
-Hi, Grandma. -Hi, Grandma.
Look at you, girls. You're growing like weeds. Look at you.
translation.ko: 어디 보자, 내 새끼들 못 본 사이 많이 컸구나

translation.en: You have the spitting image of your mother when she was your age.
translation.ko: 너희 엄마 어렸을 때를 쏙 빼닮았구나

translation.en: Oh, Gran. Hi, I missed you.
-Where's Dad? -Oh, he's in Boston.
He's building a retirement community for people over 55.
Who retires at 55?
Dinner's ready, and I have all your favorites.
translation.ko: 저녁 차려 놨다 네가 제일 좋아하는

translation.en: -My biscuits. -I'm doing a juice thing.
Oh, I'll make note of that.
Abby's home!
-Jess! -Jess!
Hi, Jess.
Hi.
All right, I'm here.
What is the big secret? What's going on?
Uh, I can't tell you. I have to show you.
translation.ko: 아직은 말 못 해 직접 보여 줄게

translation.en: -Jess? -Can I please have two minutes
to say hello to my beautiful nieces before you start grilling me?
translation.ko: 우리 예쁜 조카들한테 인사 좀 하면 안 될까?

translation.en: Oh my God, you guys are so big.
I'm obsessed with your hair. Are these highlights?
Highlights? She's nine.
-Yeah, nine isn't nine anymore. -What does that mean?
translation.ko: - 시대가 변했거든요 - 그건 또 무슨 소리야?

translation.en: Okay, come inside. Tell me everything. Let's go.
-I am so happy to see you. -Come on. What do you want to do first?
No, I will take it.
Okay. I put you in your old room and I put the girls in Jess's room.
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 넌 옛날 네 방 쓰고 애들은 제스 방을 쓰거라

translation.en: Jess's room? Why isn't Jess in Jess's room?
Wait, she didn't tell you?
Tell me what? What am I doing here? What's going on?
translation.ko: 무슨 얘기요? 무슨 일이길래 부른 거죠?

translation.en: Well, it's not my place to say,
and it's not your responsibility to fix it.
translation.ko: 네가 나서서 해결할 필요가 없다는 것만 명심해

translation.en: -Well, if that's... -You've been rescuing that girl
since the day that your mother left.
You two, sit right over here by me.
translation.ko: 너희 둘은 내 옆에 앉는 거다

translation.en: You, here,
and you're in this spot.
-Okay, tell me everything. How's school? -It's summer.
translation.ko: - 됐다, 요즘 학교는 어때? - 여름 방학이에요

translation.en: Oh, right. Wait till you grow up and you realize
translation.ko: 그렇구나 너희도 어른이 되면 알 거야

translation.en: you don't get summers off anymore. It's a rude awakening.
translation.ko: 어른은 여름 방학이 없거든 완전 짜증 나지

translation.en: We're supposed to get our ears pierced tomorrow.
-I can totally do that for you. -Uh, that is not going to happen.
translation.ko: - 이모가 해 줄게 - 절대 안 돼

translation.en: Well, I wasn't going to freeze their earlobes with an ice cube
translation.ko: 내가 얼음으로 귓불을 얼리고 할머니 바늘로 직접

translation.en: and use one of Gran's needles.
I meant, I would take them to Vera's Jewelers tomorrow.
Oh, hey, have you heard from Bree? I've sent her three messages.
translation.ko: 브리는 소식 없어? 문자를 세 통 보냈는데 답이 없네

translation.en: She never calls me back, either.
translation.ko: 나한테도 한 번도 답장 안 해 주던데?

translation.en: But you know how she gets when she's working on a new play.
translation.ko: 새로 작품 들어갈 때마다 이상해지는 거 알잖아

translation.en: Oh, I got an e-mail from Kevin. It's four more months, right?
I won't feel safe until he's home.
translation.ko: 귀국 전까진 안심 못 할 거야

translation.en: I hate Afghanistan.
You pierced Mommy's ears?
What?
That would be dangerous and irresponsible.
Can you believe Connor only has one year left of law school?
translation.ko: 코너가 1년 뒤면 법대 졸업한다는 게 믿어져?

translation.en: Feel free to break the law. We'll have a lawyer in the family.
translation.ko: 이제 법을 어겨도 돼 집안에 변호사가 생기거든

translation.en: -Excuse me. -What?
I'm the cool aunt.
Okay, just kidding.
Never break the law and also don't run with scissors,
translation.ko: 법은 절대 어기면 안 돼 가위 들고 뛰어다녀도 안 되고

translation.en: and always write thank you notes.
Nana's fried chicken.
Oh, I can't eat any of this.
-Oh, sorry. It's just a reminder. -To do what?
It's an app that I have. It keeps my entire life on schedule.
translation.ko: 제 일정을 통째로 관리해 주는 앱인데

translation.en: Every minute is accounted for, so I don't miss anything.
translation.ko: 분 단위로 일정을 알려 줘서 놓치는 게 없게 도와줘요

translation.en: Seems to me that if you have to be reminded not to miss something,
translation.ko: 할 일을 알려 주는 알림이가 필요할 정도면

translation.en: you might be missing everything.
translation.ko: 네가 놓치는 게 정말 많은 것 같구나

translation.en: Jess.
Lord, bless this food set before us.
translation.ko: 주님, 우리 앞에 놓인 음식에 은총을 주시어

translation.en: Let this meal nurture our beautiful children,
translation.ko: 우리 어여쁜 자녀들에게 양분이 되게 하소서

translation.en: and we thank you for having us here together as a family,
translation.ko: 우리 가족을 이 자리에 모이게 하신 은혜에 감사하며

translation.en: and please, watch over the ones that are not here with us now.
translation.ko: 오늘 함께하지 못한 자녀들을 지켜 주시옵소서

translation.en: -Amen. -Amen.
Yum, thank you.
-Abby, your favorite biscuits. -Thanks, Gran.
translation.ko: - 네가 좋아하는 비스킷이야 - 잘 먹을게요, 할머니

translation.en: -Thank you. -You're welcome.
Where are we going? I've had a very long day.
There it is.
The Cramers' house?
I bought it, and I live here.
You bought the Cramers' house? Why?
You know how you're always telling me to find something to commit to?
translation.ko: 내 것으로 만들 수 있는 일을 찾으라며

translation.en: Something to make my own? A passion project?
I was talking about grad school.
I bought it, and I've been fixing it up,
and I'm turning it into a bed-and-breakfast.
I got a small business loan from the bank--
Jess.
What do you know about running a hotel?
It's not a hotel. It's a bed-and-breakfast.
And it's not that hard. It's like having sleepovers that pay you.
translation.ko: 어려울 거 없어, 그냥 손님이 돈 내고 자고 가는 데야

translation.en: It's beautiful, right?
I mean, you would totally stay here, wouldn't you?
Yeah.
It's really cute. I'm...
Jess, the stained glass, the furniture, it must've cost you a fortune.
It's an investment.
"You got to spend money to make money," Steve Jobs said that.
translation.ko: '돈은 벌려면 먼저 쓰라'고 스티브 잡스도 말했잖아

translation.en: Oh, my God.
I knew you were going to freak out,
but it's not as bad as it looks.
It's exactly as bad as it looks.
Well, I didn't know I was going to have to pay for new pipes.
translation.ko: 나도 파이프 교체까지 하게 될 줄은 몰랐어

translation.en: That was not my fault.
That was an unforeseen business expense.
Again, Steve Jobs.
Okay, this is where I need you. I need help with the bank.
translation.ko: 언니를 부른 건 은행 일 때문이야

translation.en: They're threatening to foreclose on my loan
because I missed a couple payments, and--
translation.ko: 내가 이자를 몇 번 못 냈거든

translation.en: Okay, Jess. This is Chesapeake Shores.
Just have Dad talk to Mr. Riley at the bank--
translation.ko: 아빠한테 라일리 씨에게 얘기해 달라고 부탁드려

translation.en: No, I don't want Dad's help. I'm doing this on my own.
translation.ko: 싫어, 아빠 도움 없이 혼자 힘으로 해결할 거야

translation.en: I just need you to help me talk to the bank
about getting an extension on my loan or something.
translation.ko: 대출 연장이나 뭐 그런 거 말이야

translation.en: -Okay. -Okay.
Okay, call Mr. Riley in the morning and have him meet us at the bank.
translation.ko: 아침에 라일리 씨한테 전화해서 우리가 가겠다고 전해

translation.en: -I don't know what I can do though. -Okay, this is everything you'll need.
translation.ko: - 내가 도움이 될지 모르겠다 - 필요한 서류는 여기 있어

translation.en: Thank you so much.
You're the best sister in the world.
-It'll be okay. -Okay.
Let's go get ice cream.
No, I do not eat ice cream. I mean...
Yes, you do. Come on.
Fine.
Did you wait up for me?
Gran, I'm 34 years old.
Abby, darling, I always wait up until everyone's home in bed.
translation.ko: 식구들이 다 들어오기 전엔 먼저 자 본 적이 없단다

translation.en: Well, it's a good thing you don't know what happened
after you went to bed when we were young.
translation.ko: 어렸을 때 할머니 주무시면 몰래 빠져나가곤 했는데

translation.en: What's the statute of limitations on being grounded?
When you used to sneak out the second-story window
and shimmy down the lattice work after I'd gone to bed?
You knew?
Did you ever wonder why I had the lattice reinforced?
translation.ko: 내가 창문 옆 지지대를 왜 튼튼하게 수리했겠니?

translation.en: You were the oldest, and you were a good girl.
I could give you a little space.
translation.ko: 그 정돈 눈감아 줄 수 있었지

translation.en: Well, thank you.
Do you think you're going to be able to help Jess?
translation.ko: 제스는 도울 수 있을 것 같니?

translation.en: Oh, yes.
I just need to go over her books and see what kind of shape they're in.
translation.ko: 장부를 검토하고 재무 상태만 확인하면 돼요

translation.en: She says that she just needs help extending her loan,
translation.ko: 대출 기한만 연장하게 도와 달라고 했지만

translation.en: but you know Jess.
Wes called while you were out.
I'm avoiding him.
I think he's going to tell me that he is getting remarried.
Oh, Abby. I'm so sorry.
It's just the girls I'm worried about. It's a lot of change for them.
translation.ko: 애들이 잘 받아들일지 걱정이에요, 큰 변화잖아요

translation.en: Yeah.
-I love you. -Thanks, Gran.
Jess.
You have 26 unheard messages.
Shut up.
Oh, Franny's Flower Shop closed?
Yeah, Bert and Franny moved to Florida after Candy had their fifth grandchild.
translation.ko: 응, 플로리다로 이사하셨어 캔디가 다섯째 아이를 낳았거든

translation.en: Candy has five children? Wow, she's younger than I am.
Someone you never expected to see again is back working here.
translation.ko: 언니가 깜짝 놀랄 만한 사람이 은행에 돌아왔어

translation.en: -Who? -It's a surprise.
-Abby. -Hi, Mariah.
-It's been a long time. -Yeah, how are you?
-Great. -We need to see Mr. Riley.
translation.ko: - 잘 지냈지 - 라일리 씨 뵈러 왔어요

translation.en: I think he's in his office. I'll just buzz.
I know where to go.
Thanks.
Hey.
Abby O'Brien.
Back in Chesapeake Shores.
It's been a long time.
Yeah. It's good to see you again, Trace.
You...
You look great.
Hey, Jess.
-Hey. -I got your call.
-Oh, yeah. -Of course, you know why we're here,
translation.ko: - 맞다 - 우리가 왜 왔는지 알 테니

translation.en: so can we just get straight to it?
We understand there have been some fiscal oversights,
we're prepared to offer the bank assurance that Jess--
-Actually, Trace-- -Could you just
let me handle this? Thanks.
However, this is also about the egregious interest-only mortgage
translation.ko: 하지만 이 터무니없는 담보 대출도 문제야

translation.en: that never should've been offered to Jess in the first place.
translation.ko: 제스한테 이런 대출을 해 준 것 자체가 문제라고

translation.en: Egregious? That doesn't sound very friendly now, does it?
I mean, this is the friendly bank.
Well, my sister came to you in good faith and I think
-she deserves an opportunity to-- -Jess's file is right here.
Why don't we take a look?
It appears the bank has already initiated foreclosure proceedings on the property.
translation.ko: 은행이 벌써 압류 절차를 시작한 것 같은데

translation.en: That's what happens when people don't keep their word.
translation.ko: 약속을 안 지키니까 이런 일이 생기는 거야

translation.en: -Don't make this about you and me. -You and me?
-There's a you and me? -You know what I mean.
This is business. It's not personal.
You can't punish Jess for something I did.
translation.ko: 내가 했던 일로 제스한테 화풀이하진 마

translation.en: Is that what I am doing?
Because that would be totally egregious.
You know what?
Jess has a new investment partner.
I do?
I totally do.
Yes and she has more than enough cash flow to pay back the bank loans
translation.ko: 조만간 자금 융통이 돼서 은행 대출도 갚고

translation.en: and to capitalize the running of the bed-and-breakfast
translation.ko: 베드 앤 브렉퍼스트 운영도 문제없을 거야

translation.en: for at least the next year or so--
-Abby I-- -Could you please...
Okay, I'll be anywhere else.
Yeah.
Sounds like you really know your stuff.
You must've learned a lot on Wall Street.
translation.ko: 월 가에서 공부 많이 했나 봐

translation.en: You made the right decision fleeing to New York.
I didn't flee. I moved.
translation.ko: 도망간 게 아니라 이사 간 거지

translation.en: It's not moving when you leave without saying goodbye to your fiancé.
translation.ko: 약혼자한테 작별 인사도 안 하고 갔잖아

translation.en: We weren't engaged.
Okay, we talked about it. Yes, obviously, but we were children,
translation.ko: 물론 그런 얘기는 했지만 그땐 둘 다 어렸어

translation.en: and if I hadn't left when I did, I might've never left.
translation.ko: 그때 안 떠났으면 영영 못 떠났을 거야

translation.en: We were supposed to leave together.
I know, but--
But you figured when it came down to it, I wouldn't go.
translation.ko: 내가 안 떠날 거라고 멋대로 믿은 거잖아

translation.en: -Okay, it wasn't just that-- -And even if I did,
translation.ko: - 그것 때문만은 아니었어 - 같이 떠난다 해도

translation.en: I would fail in the real world with my music,
and end up right back here working for my father
translation.ko: 결국 아버지 밑에 남을 거라고 생각했겠지

translation.en: at his bank.
You couldn't tie your string to that kite.
translation.ko: 그런 놈이랑 엮이는 게 싫었을 테고

translation.en: Could you?
It wasn't just that. I mean, not...
completely.
It was really good seeing you, Abby.
You knew, and you did not stop me.
I tried to, but you were being so bossy.
You told me that there was someone I'd be very surprised to see
translation.ko: 은행에 내가 보면 깜짝 놀랄 사람이 있다고 한 건

translation.en: working back at the bank.
Yeah, I meant Mr. Binkow.
-I thought he died. -So did I.
Surprise.
And Trace?
He's been back for about six months.
I'm not sure what's going on with him. He doesn't work at the bank.
translation.ko: 무슨 사연인지는 모르겠고 은행에서 일하진 않아

translation.en: Yes, I got that. Thank you.
It would've been really nice to know before I made a complete fool of myself.
translation.ko: 미리 알았더라면 좋았을 텐데 나만 바보 됐잖아

translation.en: I didn't know he was here. He was probably visiting his dad.
translation.ko: 나도 여기 올 줄은 몰랐어 아버지 뵈러 왔나 봐

translation.en: I'm mortified, so...
Well, you should be.
He's been helping me rebuild the floors.
We owe him a lot of money.
I need to clear my head, so I'm going to walk home alone.
translation.ko: 생각도 정리할 겸 집까지 걸어서 갈게

translation.en: I love you!
Abby, welcome home!
Hi, Sally.
Can I get a cup of mint tea, please?
Sure.
Lunch is ready.
-Lunch? -Well, I figured you'd be hungry,
after running this morning and going to the bank with Jess.
How do you know that?
Donna Martin saw you running on the shore this morning,
translation.ko: 아침에 해변에서 뛰는 건 도나 마틴이 봤고

translation.en: and then Mariah called and said you were at the bank.
translation.ko: 은행에 간 건 머라이어가 전화로 말해 줬죠

translation.en: Right, I forgot about being in a small town,
translation.ko: 이 동네가 얼마나 좁은지 잊고 있었네요

translation.en: but I actually don't eat this way anymore.
I know, Nell told me.
Double hickory burger and curly fries, our favorite.
translation.ko: 더블버거에 감자튀김이라 우리가 제일 좋아하는 메뉴네

translation.en: Oh, my gosh!
-I thought you were out of town. -I am. I was.
translation.ko: - 보스턴에 계신 줄 알았어요 - 방금 왔어

translation.en: Gran called and told me you and the girls were coming home,
so I jumped on a plane.
Well, it was a very last-minute decision.
You know what? I'll tell you what.
I know Jess shouldn't have dragged you into her mess.
translation.ko: 제스가 너까지 끌어들이면 안 되는 거였어

translation.en: I'll call Sam Riley tomorrow and have her loan extended.
Actually, she wants to do this on her own. She doesn't want your help.
translation.ko: 제스가 아빠 도움 없이 스스로 해결하겠대요

translation.en: And yet, here you are.
-Hey, Sal. -Hey.
You know, I...
I think she just wants to prove to you that...
translation.ko: 제스가 아빠한테 보여 주고 싶은 것 같아요

translation.en: I don't know. She just wants you to be proud of her.
translation.ko: 아빠가 자랑할 만한 딸이 되고 싶나 봐요

translation.en: I'm proud of all of my children.
Well, she doesn't seem to know that, so...
-Well... -I mean, she was so young when Mom left,
and you were always busy working and...
Hey, Mick, good to see you.
Hey. Good to see you, Dan.
-Hey, Henry. What's going on? -Hi.
translation.ko: - 헨리, 무슨 일 있나? - 잘 지냈나?

translation.en: I wanted to talk to you about the old church.
translation.ko: 교회 문제로 묻고 싶은 게 있네

translation.en: Some people have approached the historical committee
about you tearing it down.
The rumor is you plan on turning it into commercial--
translation.ko: 그 자리에 상업 시설을 짓는다는 소문이야

translation.en: Henry, please don't listen to rumors, okay?
They're like wildfires.
Someone lights a spark,
it spreads slowly, burns fast and causes all sorts of damage.
-Okay, fair enough-- -My family built this town.
translation.ko: - 그건 알겠는데... - 우리 가문이 세운 마을이야

translation.en: And no one wants to protect the shore more than we do.
translation.ko: 누구보다 우리가 가장 마을을 지키고 싶어 한다고

translation.en: Your brother is concerned.
My brother thinks we have to keep all the original parts
translation.ko: 동생은 역사를 보존하려면 모든 걸 원래대로

translation.en: in order to preserve history.
Now, if that were true, you wouldn't have that new hip, would you?
translation.ko: 그게 진리라면 자넨 인공 관절 수술도 못 받았어, 안 그래?

translation.en: -Okay, I get that-- -We're talking about renovation here.
translation.ko: - 무슨 말인지 알겠네 - 보수 공사만 할 거야

translation.en: Nothing more.
That church has to be propped up, or it's going to fall down.
And don't forget, I'm the one who formed the historical committee
translation.ko: 사적지 보존위원회도 내가 만들었다는 거 잊지 말게

translation.en: -to protect the shore. -Yes.
-Yes, you did. -Okay.
I told you there's nothing to worry about.
-Good to see you, Mick. -See you.
Face-to-face and look them in the eye. That's how honest business gets done.
translation.ko: 얼굴 보고 대화하는 거 이게 정직한 사업 방식이지

translation.en: E-mailing gives you half the story.
So, you are renovating the old church?
Well, just looking into it. Early stages.
Sally, you know what? I'm not going to have time to eat that.
translation.ko: 샐리, 점심 먹을 시간은 없을 것 같아요

translation.en: I got to run. Just put that on my tab.
translation.ko: 지금 가야 해요 계산은 나중에 할게요

translation.en: See you at dinner?
-I'm getting fresh crabs. -Oh, great.
-I'm so glad you're home. -Me, too.
-Bye, Pops. -Bye, Sal. Bye, honey.
translation.ko: - 안녕히 가세요 - 잘 있어요, 집에서 보자

translation.en: Bye.
So,
how was it seeing Trace after all these years?
Mariah said he was at the bank.
translation.ko: 머라이어 말로는 은행에서 트레이스 봤다고 했어요

translation.en: His mom says he's been doing pretty well with his band.
translation.ko: 라일리 부인 말이 트레이스가 음악적으로 꽤 성공했대요

translation.en: They travel all over Nashville. Bars, clubs, stuff like that.
translation.ko: 내슈빌의 바와 클럽에서 공연도 정말 많이 하고

translation.en: You know he had a song on the radio a while back?
translation.ko: 얼마 전엔 라디오에도 나왔던 거 알아요?

translation.en: Yeah, I heard that.
So I wonder why he's back.
I mean, something must have happened, right?
translation.ko: 분명 무슨 일이 있는 거예요, 그렇죠?

translation.en: I have no idea.
Everyone always thought you two would end up together.
Right. None of my business.
Hi, Millie. I need you to clear my Monday.
translation.ko: 밀리, 월요일 일정을 전부 미뤄 줘요

translation.en: I have some business to take care of here, but I'll be in the office on Tuesday.
translation.ko: 여기서 처리할 일이 생겼어요 화요일에는 꼭 출근할게요

translation.en: Gabrielle called a partner meeting for Monday at noon.
translation.ko: 개브리엘이 월요일 정오에 파트너 회의를 소집했어요

translation.en: What? Why?
Put me through to her.
Actually, no. Tell her that she needs to reschedule the meeting
translation.ko: 아니에요, 그냥 내가 사무실에 돌아갈 때까지만

translation.en: for when I am back in the office.
Millie, I'm going to call you back.
Serina. Thank you for getting back to me.
We're going to be here until Monday, and so I...
What? What's going on?
-Oh, how did things go at the bank? -Oh, it'll be fine.
translation.ko: - 은행 일은 잘 끝났니? - 별문제 없을 거예요

translation.en: I'm going to stay until Monday and co-sign on Jess's loan for her.
translation.ko: 제가 월요일까지 있다가 제스의 빚보증을 서 줄 거예요

translation.en: Oh, you're such a good sister.
translation.ko: 이렇게 좋은 언니가 어디 또 있겠니!

translation.en: Well, as an added bonus, my nanny just quit.
translation.ko: 그런데 방금 보모가 그만두겠다고 전화 왔어요

translation.en: The girls love her, and I have no idea how I'm going to replace her.
translation.ko: 애들이 정말 좋아했는데 어디서 그런 사람을 또 찾죠?

translation.en: They have you.
I'm a single, working mother
and I need someone to be me when I'm not there.
translation.ko: 저 대신 애들을 돌봐 줄 사람이 필요해요

translation.en: You're the one who told me that you need to be home for 1,000 hours
translation.ko: 할머니가 그러셨잖아요 1천 시간 동안 집에 있어도

translation.en: to be there for the 15 minutes that matter.
-Oh, Dad's home. -Oh, I know.
translation.ko: - 맞다, 아빠가 오셨어요 - 그래, 나도 안다

translation.en: Sally called me.
Is nothing in this town private?
Privacy is overrated.
So, Trace is back.
Oh, I heard.
Why didn't you tell me?
I don't like to gossip.
This is a blessing.
I haven't seen this many O'Briens at a table
translation.ko: 이렇게 많은 식구가 식탁에 둘러앉았던 게

translation.en: in I don't know how long.
What I wouldn't give to have the whole family here
for the Fourth of July.
Well, we have to get back, actually. We can't stay that long.
translation.ko: 사실 우린 가야 해요 여기 오래 못 있어요

translation.en: I have so much work to do, and the girls...
They start summer school on Monday.
No, we don't. We still have two more weeks.
Oh, that's right. You have ballet.
We're not doing ballet anymore. We're doing tap.
translation.ko: 지금은 발레 안 해요 탭 댄스 배워요

translation.en: Well, we don't have your tap shoes yet.
Yes, we do. Serina took us.
translation.ko: 세리나 아줌마가 데리고 가서 사 줬어요

translation.en: Okay, well, what about your ballet recital?
You guys were going to be mice. I was so excited to see that.
translation.ko: 너희가 쥐 역할 맡았대서 나도 잔뜩 기대하고 있는데

translation.en: We already did it. You were in Chicago.
translation.ko: 그건 벌써 끝났어요 엄마는 시카고 출장 가서

translation.en: Daddy and Gabrielle came.
No, I have it in my calendar.
It is next week...
And...
How are things at the inn?
It's not an inn, it's a bed-and-breakfast, and everything's good.
translation.ko: 베드 앤 브렉퍼스트예요 다 잘돼 가요

translation.en: Should be open by September or October.
Well, that's wonderful.
If you need any help, I'd love to--
-I have everything under control. -I'm sure you do.
Just saying I've got local contractors--
I'm good, thanks.
You know, I never allowed phone calls at the table when you were kids.
translation.ko: 너희들 어렸을 땐 식탁에서 통화 금지였어

translation.en: That's because cell phones didn't exist when we were growing up.
Well, that's semantics.
It's just my assistant. I'll call her back.
Your assistant works on Saturday?
That's a commitment.
It's Saturday?
-What's wrong? -Oh, nothing, sweetie.
I'm sorry. I need to make a phone call. I'll be right back.
translation.ko: 죄송해요 전화 한 통만 하고 올게요

translation.en: Do you have any queens?
That's good.
So, what was that phone call about?
I had a date tonight.
It's a friend of mine. Set me up with his tax attorney,
and he's really cute and tall and successful,
translation.ko: 정말 귀엽고 키도 크고 잘나가는 사람인데

translation.en: and I've canceled on him three times.
I told him I would absolutely be there tonight.
You've canceled on him three times?
-I don't think you wanted to go. -Do you have any eights?
translation.ko: - 별 마음이 없는 것 같은데 - 숫자 8 카드 있나요?

translation.en: No, I do. I just forgot.
What was the name of that floppy old bunny that you used to carry around with you
translation.ko: 그 너덜너덜한 토끼 인형 이름이 뭐였더라? 네가 두 살 때

translation.en: when you were two years old?
-Fluffy Nunny. -Fluffy Nunny.
You never forget the stuff you care about.
Oh, no.
I get three shots.
Well, I haven't been on a date in over a year, and...
I've forgotten how to flirt.
My really cute neighbor winked at me the other day,
and I gave him the number for my eye doctor.
translation.ko: 안과 의사 전화번호를 알려 줬지 뭐니

translation.en: Go on some dates. Get back in the game. Join Match or Tinder.
translation.ko: 남자 좀 만나 만남 사이트에 가입하든지

translation.en: Yeah, I...
I buy my shampoo and conditioner in one bottle
because I don't have time for two steps.
I don't have time to date.
Excuse me? You do not go on those dating sites, do you?
translation.ko: 인터넷 만남 사이트 가입한 거 아니지?

translation.en: Because they are dangerous.
Yeah. Thanks, Mom.
Speaking of Mom, how is she?
translation.ko: 말 나온 김에 묻는 건데 엄마는 어떠셔?

translation.en: She is fine, you know.
How can you even have her in your life?
Oh, Jess, I'm not having this conversation again with you.
translation.ko: 제스, 이 얘기는 또 하고 싶지 않아

translation.en: She abandoned us, Abby.
She didn't abandon us, she moved, and she planned to take us with her,
but Dad convinced her to let us stay here, in our house
translation.ko: 아빠가 설득해서 포기하신 거야 우리 집도 여기 있고

translation.en: with our friends and our school.
Well, let me ask you this.
Would you leave Caitlyn and Carrie and move away from them?
translation.ko: 언니는 케이틀린과 캐리를 두고 떠날 수 있어?

translation.en: Are there any circumstances under which you would walk out on them?
translation.ko: 애들 버리고 집을 나갈 수 있냐고!

translation.en: We are all grown up now.
We're not depending on our parents for anything anymore.
What age is it when you stop needing a mother and a father?
translation.ko: 부모가 필요 없어지는 나이는 대체 몇 살인데?

translation.en: When does that happen? Because I'm still waiting.
translation.ko: 그게 언제냐고! 난 아직도 기다리고 있거든

translation.en: How pathetic does that make me
that I'm still waiting for them to come home?
translation.ko: 엄마 아빠가 돌아오길 아직도 기다린다는 게

translation.en: Jess.
Bye.
I thought you were leaving town.
I am. I just
have some business to take care of with your dad at the bank,
where you apparently do not work.
I'm really sorry about the other day.
No big deal.
I'm used to you thinking you know everything.
That is not fair.
Hey, Trace, can we just talk about it for a minute?
You can try,
but I doubt you can keep up.
Oh, really?
I have been outrunning you since we were, like...
Hey!
Trace!
You got slow.
I had two children.
Years ago.
So, you have a place here now?
Yes, I do.
Unlike you, I like it here.
I like it here.
-Sure you do. -I do.
You forget how long I've known you.
I like having a house on the water.
A place where I can just
breathe, you know?
Recharge.
A house on the water?
I bought the beach shack on Spirit Cove.
translation.ko: 스피릿 코브에 있는 오두막 내가 샀어

translation.en: I've been fixing it up.
You bought the beach shack?
I always said I would.
I mean, that was the plan, right?
Yes, that was the plan when we were 16 years old.
We were going to run away and live there
where no one could find us, or tell us what to do.
translation.ko: 같이 도망가서 거기서 살자고 했잖아 아무도 우리를 못 찾고 잔소리도 할 수 없는 데서

translation.en: It was a good plan.
Yeah, I can't believe my dad sold it to you.
He said he was not going to sell it.
Well, I guess he changed his mind.
He said one thing and did another.
translation.ko: 말씀은 그렇게 하셨어도 결국 나한테 파셨으니까

translation.en: So, how's your music going?
It's great. Yeah.
It's really good.
So, you're just home to breathe and recharge?
Yes.
Yeah? You sure there's nothing else going on?
translation.ko: 그래? 정말 아무 일 없는 거야?

translation.en: No.
You forget how long I've known you.
-I don't understand. -You don't have to understand.
translation.ko: - 이해 못 하겠어요 - 이해할 필요 없어

translation.en: Just look at the clouds and see the pictures.
translation.ko: 그냥 구름을 보면서 그림을 떠올리면 돼

translation.en: I just see clouds.
Close your eyes now. Let's imagine, let's pretend.
translation.ko: 눈을 감아 봐 그리고 상상을 하는 거야

translation.en: Imagine that you're in a fairy tale in the sky.
translation.ko: 하늘에 있는 요정 나라에 갔다고 상상해 보렴

translation.en: Now, open your eyes!
I see an elephant.
I see a girl in a tutu dancing on a horse.
translation.ko: 발레복 입은 아이가 말 위에서 춤을 춰요

translation.en: No, on a unicorn.
-Which one of us is right? -You both are.
translation.ko: - 누가 맞아요? - 너희 둘 다 맞아

translation.en: You can't get that in New York City.
translation.ko: 뉴욕에선 저런 거 꿈도 못 꿀걸?

translation.en: Hey.
You sold Trace the beach house.
Yeah, he bought it six years ago.
He's been asking if he could buy it since he was 18, and I finally gave in.
translation.ko: 18살 때부터 그 집을 팔라고 졸랐잖니 내가 결국 항복했지

translation.en: He's been fixing it up over the years. It needs a lot of work.
translation.ko: 그 애가 계속 고치더구나 손볼 데가 많을 거야

translation.en: You built that with your brothers. You said you would never sell it.
translation.ko: 삼촌들과 같이 지은 집이라 절대 안 판다고 하셨잖아요

translation.en: I know, but he had the money, and he was very persistent,
and he said something to me
that made me change my mind about selling it.
Which was?
He said it reminded him of the best time in his life.
translation.ko: 그 집을 보면 자기 삶의 최고의 순간이 떠오른다더군

translation.en: Whatever that means.
Hello?
-Hey. -Hey.
This place is amazing.
It's so much different than when we were kids.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 봤던 거랑 많이 달라졌어

translation.en: Isn't that the truth?
Now it has a front door,
and I have the keys.
-Is he yours? -Axel?
Yeah, he's been with me for like ten years.
Come here, Axel. Hey, boy.
That's longer than I was married.
I heard.
You know, I never liked Wes.
translation.ko: 난 웨스, 그 작자가 처음부터 마음에 안 들었어

translation.en: -You never met him. -Didn't need to.
translation.ko: - 본 적도 없잖아 - 안 봐도 알아

translation.en: This deck is beautiful.
Your grandfather would be so proud of you.
"Carpentry is a valuable skill.
Learn a trade. Keep it in your back pocket."
He was right.
You know, I built all my own furniture back in Nashville.
translation.ko: 내슈빌에서도 가구는 전부 내 손으로 만들었어

translation.en: That's amazing.
Well, I mean, you always loved working with your hands, so...
My grandfather always got me in a way my father never could.
translation.ko: 아버지보다 할아버지가 나랑 더 잘 맞았던 것 같아

translation.en: Yeah, I know.
Do you remember that wooden box you made me in shop class?
translation.ko: 공작 시간에 나한테 나무 상자 만들어 줬던 것 기억나?

translation.en: It was the first thing I ever made.
I remember I burned our initials on the top.
Look.
I know you've been helping Jess with the floors,
and we owe you a lot of money, so I can...
-I can write you a check. -Jess and I will work it out.
translation.ko: - 내가 지불할게 - 그건 제스랑 내가 해결할게

translation.en: Okay.
Well, I'm going back to New York tonight,
so I just want to make sure there's no unfinished business.
translation.ko: 여기 일은 확실히 끝내고 가고 싶어

translation.en: Don't worry, Abby. There's no unfinished business here.
You travel safe.
